title.narrative: Physical Security and Stockpile Management (PSSM) in Peru in Support of Improved Regional Security and Stability

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to Increase regional security and stability by strengthening the effective management of state-help weapons and ammunition. MAG will work to 1) reduce the risk of diversion through destruction of excess and obsolete munitions and Small Arms and Light Weapons (SALW), 2) improve the capacity of national security forces to conduct stockpile management, weapons cutting and explosive ordnance disposal, and 3) assess, make recommendations for and implement improvements of safety and security conditions at weapons and munitions storage facilities. MAG plans to assess at least 6 facilities and conduct physical security interventions as needed. MAG will also train at least 10 host nation personnel in EOD3, armory storekeeping and management, and Small Arms Ammunition (SAA) and weapons destruction. As identifies, MAG will also cut weapons, burn SAA, and destroy munitions.
